title: How to Make Vegan Whipped Cream

steps.headline: Place the coconut milk, the agave nectar, the whisk attachments to your electric mixer and your metal bowl into the freezer for 15 minutes.
Pour the chilled coconut milk into the cold bowl.
Use a rubber spatula to get the cream at the bottom of the cans into the bowl.
Whip the coconut milk using an electric mixer set on high for about 5 minutes, or until it is very fluffy.
steps.description: The mixture should hold soft peaks when scooped.

steps.headline: Beat in the vanilla, agave nectar, and flour one tablespoon at a time.
steps.description: Continue to test for flavor and texture.

steps.headline: Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill the whipped cream in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours before serving.
steps.description: This chilling process allows the whipped cream to firm.

text: Place the coconut milk, the agave nectar, the whisk attachments to your electric mixer and your metal bowl into the freezer for 15 minutes.  Pour the chilled coconut milk into the cold bowl.  Use a rubber spatula to get the cream at the bottom of the cans into the bowl.  Whip the coconut milk using an electric mixer set on high for about 5 minutes, or until it is very fluffy. The mixture should hold soft peaks when scooped. Beat in the vanilla, agave nectar, and flour one tablespoon at a time. Continue to test for flavor and texture. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and chill the whipped cream in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours before serving. This chilling process allows the whipped cream to firm.
